result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J. Hedstrom

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 2:48 pm. 

Deft appears in person and with Attorney Andrew Morgan.

*** COURT QUASHES BENCH WARRANT ***

Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed in this case; Atty Morgan states he has been appointed on other open cases and presumes he will be appointed on this case as well. 
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver.
PTC: 11/02/2022 @ 2:50 pm. 

Adj: 2:51 pm.
PTC held; Future dates set; Deft needs counsel appointed on newest file; Directed to provide SPD with documentation.
Pre-trial conference on November 2, 2022 at 02:50 pm.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:26 pm. 
 
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Defendant fails to appear.
COURT notes deft. was in court last week and advised of today's hearing; notice of hearing was also mailed. 
COURT does not find deft. is incarcerated at this time. 
COURT ORDERS: BWA $1,000.00.

Adj: 1:27 pm.
Review hearing on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:14 pm. 

Deft appears in person, pro se.  
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes SPD is waiting for verification information from deft. to determine eligibility. 
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Prelim set for 09/26/2022 to be removed from calendar. 
Review set for 09/28/2022 at 1:00 pm in Courtroom B. 

Adj: 1:18 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Defendant shall not possess or use any firearms during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.

State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears from MCJ, w/ Attorney Jack Mathie.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.

PO HOLD.

- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  715-301-8625
